introduction.p: Compare the procedures for solving power equations and exponential equations.

statement.p: Solve ~3x^{1.05} = 18~. Round your answer to hundredths.
Solve ~3(1.05)^x = 18~. Round your answer to hundredths.

solution.p: This is an exponential equation. We divide both sides by 3, then take logarithms. \log(1.05^x) \amp = \log 6 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Apply the third log property.}} x \log 1.05\amp = \log 6 x \amp =\dfrac{\log 6}{\log 1.05} = 36.72

statement.p: Solve ~9x^{3/5} = 36~. Round your answer to hundredths.
Solve ~1.5(3^{x/5}) = 12~. Round your answer to hundredths.

solution.p: This is an exponential equation. We divide both sides by 1.5, then take logarithms. \log 3^{x/5} \amp = \log 8 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Apply the third log property.}} \dfrac{x}{5} \log 3 \amp = \log 8 x \amp =\dfrac{5\log 8}{\log 3} = 9.46

assemblage.title: Doubling Time and Half-Life
assemblage.p: If D is the doubling time for an exponential function P(t), then P(t) = P_0 2^{t/D}
If H is the half-life for an exponential function Q(t), then Q(t)=Q_0 (0.5)^{t/H}

statement.p: The half-life of a cold medication in the body is 6 hours. Find its decay rate.

solution.p: The decay law for the medication is N=N_0(0.5)^{t/8} We can rewrite this expression as N=N_0(0.5^{1/8})^t so b=0.5^{1/8}=0.9170, and r=1-b=0.083. The decay rate is 8.3%.

statement.p: The growth rate of a population of badgers is 3.8% per year. Find its doubling time.
The doubling time for a population is 18 years. Find its annual growth rate.
A radioactive isotope decays by 0.04% per second. What is its half-life?

introduction.p: From a graph, we can read the initial value of an exponential function and then its doubling time or hlaf-life. From there we can calculate the growth or decay law.

statement.p:
The graph shows the population, P, of a herd of llamas t years after 2000.
How many llamas were there in 2000?
What is the doubling time for the population?
What is the annual growth rate for the population?

ol.label: a
ol.li: The initial value of the population is given by the P-intercept of the graph, (0,15). There were 15 llamas in 2000.
Look for the time when the initial llama population doubles. When t=4,~P=30, and when t=8,~P=60, so the llama population doubles every 4 years.
The growth factor for the population is 2^{1/4} = 1.189, so the annual growth rate is 18.9%.

statement.p: Write a decay law for the graph shown below, where t is in hours and N is in milligrams.

solution.p: The initial value is given by the vertical intercept of the graph, (0,600), so N_0 = 600.
When t=5,~N=300, so the half-life of the substance is 5 hours. Thus the decay law is N(t)=600(0.5)^{t/5}, or N(t)=600(0.87)^t.
